HISTORICAL CONTEXT

In order to better understand the context of the personal stories collected on this site, we have selected a eries of articles from the Yad Vashem and MV&R websites. The MV&R is an online scientific publication specializing in the study of massacres, genocides, and the local resistance they generate, and whose goal is to provide reliable information on events that are sometimes difficult to document and that remain deeply rooted in individual and collective memories. It relies on an interdisciplinary academic network based in Paris at the Centre de Recherches Internationales (CERI) and the Centre d'histoire de l'Institut Politique, also known as Sciences Po.

The Holocaust in France

For articles on the Holocaust in France, refer to the following collection of articles on the Yad Vashem website: The Holocaust in France.

Chronology of Repression and Persecution in Occupied France, 1940-44

See Sciences Po for a comprehensive chronology: Chronology, 1940-44.

The Drancy camp

For more information on the Drancy internment camp, refer to the following article from Sciences Po by Laffitte Michel: The Drancy camp.

The Vélodrome d'hiver Round-up: July 16 and 17, 1942

For a history of the large mass-arrest event of Jews known as the Vélodrome d'hiver Round-up, refer to Laffitte Michel's article on Sciences Po: The Vélodrome d'hiver Round-up: July 16 and 17, 1942.
